glsa.title: FreeRADIUS: Buffer overflow and SQL injection vulnerability
glsa.synopsis: The FreeRADIUS server is vulnerable to a buffer overflow and an SQL injection attack, possibly allowing the compromise of the system.

background.p: FreeRADIUS is an open source RADIUS authentication server implementation.

description.p: Primoz Bratanic discovered that the sql_escape_func function of FreeRADIUS may be vulnerable to a buffer overflow (BID 13541). He also discovered that FreeRADIUS fails to sanitize user-input before using it in a SQL query, possibly allowing SQL command injection (BID 13540).

impact.p: By supplying carefully crafted input, a malicious user could cause a buffer overflow or an SQL injection, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code or disclosure and the modification of sensitive data.

workaround.p: There are no known workarounds at this time.
